Name: LU 29 - Zoning, Sutter Avenue Rezoning, Brooklyn (C 210031 ZMK)
Title: Resolution approving with modifications the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 210031 ZMK, a Zoning Map amendment (Preconsidered L.U. No. 29).

History.Action: Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}{\f1\fmodern\fprq1\fcharset0 Courier;}{\f2\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Arial;}{\f3\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Calibri;}}

\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\b By Council Members Salamanca and Riley\b0\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, \cf1 Almonte Lincoln, LLC\cf0 ,\expndtw-6  filed an application \expndtw0 pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section Nos. \cf1 17c and18a\cf0 , \cf1 changing from an R5 District to an R6A District and establishing within the proposed R6A District a C2-4 District, \cf0 which in conjunction with the related action would facilitate construction of a new five-story mixed-use building containing 28 dwelling units, eight of which would be permanently affordable, as well as approximately 7,400 square feet of commercial floor area on the ground floor, located at 1377 Sutter Avenue (Block 4254, Lots 39 and 41) in the East New York neighborhood of Brooklyn, Community District 5 (ULURP No. C 210031 ZMK) (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\par
WHEREAS the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on March 4, 2022 its decision dated March 2, 2022 (the "Decision") on the Application;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tqr\tx9360\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1440\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920 WHEREAS, the Application is related to application N 210032 ZRK (Pre. L.U. No. 30), a zoning text amendment to designate a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) area with Options 1 and 2;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7560\tx7920\tx8640\tx8933\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on March 8, 2022;\par
\par
WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Negative Declaration issued October 4\super th\nosupersub , 2021 (CEQR No. \cf1 21DCP053K\cf0 ), which includes an (E) designation to avoid the potential for significant adverse impacts related to hazardous materials, air quality\f1 ,\f0  and noise impacts (E-633) (the \ldblquote Negative Declaration\rdblquote ).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx720 The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant impact on the environment as set forth in the (E) Designation (E-633) and Negative Declaration.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 210031 ZMK incorporated by reference herein, and the record before the Council, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission with the following modifications:\par
\pard\ltrpar\par
\cf1 Matter double struck out is old, deleted by the City Council; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf0 Matter \uldb double-underlined\ulnone  is new, added by the City Council\par
\pard\ltrpar\f2\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri140\qj\tx720\tx7560\f0 The Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, effective as of December 15, 1961, and as subsequently amended, is further amended by changing the Zoning Map, \cf1 Section Nos. 17c and18a:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\sa160\qj 1.\tab changing from an R5 District to an R6A District property bounded by a line 90 feet northerly of Sutter Avenue, Lincoln Avenue, Sutter Avenue, and \uldb a line 75 feet easterly of \ulnone Autumn Avenue; and\f3\par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\qj\f0\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\sa160\qj 2.\tab establishing within the proposed R6A District a C2-4 District bounded by a line 90 feet northerly of Sutter Avenue, Lincoln Avenue, Sutter Avenue, and \uldb a line 75 feet easterly of \ulnone Autumn Avenue;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 5, as shown on a diagram (for illustrative purposes only) dated October 4, 2021, and subject to the conditions of CEQR Declaration E-633.\cf0\f1\fs22\par
\pard\ltrpar\f2\fs24\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\f0 Adopted.\par
\par
\tab Office of the City Clerk, \}\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj The City of New York,  \} ss.:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1440\qj I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of a Resolution passed by The Council of The City of New York on ______________, 2022, on file in this office.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\par
